title: nvme ssd + adapter
message:
would any nvme ssd work with a cheap adapter in a retina macbook? the originals are very expensive , even the OWC ssd is not too cheap, we can buy 500gb nvme Crucial ssd for 60eur.

[URL]https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32926168645.html?spm=2114.search0104.3.1.515e3205Ul6CWQ&ws_ab_test=searchweb0_0%2Csearchweb201602_5_10065_10068_319_10059_10884_317_10887_10696_321_322_10084_453_10083_454_10103_10618_10304_10307_10820_10821_537_10302_536%2Csearchweb201603_52%2CppcSwitch_0&algo_expid=d43cc881-ec7c-41dd-9495-1c1931803513-0&algo_pvid=d43cc881-ec7c-41dd-9495-1c1931803513&transAbTest=ae803_4[/URL]

title: nvme ssd + adapter
message:
now i can confirm it works fine with a 2015 macbook pro, , simply that 2eur adapter from aliexpress, and the a 60eur cheap nvme crucial ssd 500gb, works fine with 10.13, the only thing is that it had to be formatted with a usb enclosure in another macbook , than it was recognised in the target macbook, install worked without issues, fast

i guess that is the end of the OWC company, their ssd are still much more expensive than a generic nvme SSD
